summary:
I am a social scientific and policy researcher, working on the nexus between policy, practice and research at the local, national and European level. I have worked across academic (universities and universities of applied sciences), profit (consultancies), non-profit (NGOs) and public (Ministry) sectors as (senior) researcher and consultant. Since 2011 I have been working as independent social researcher for various knowledge institutes and public sector organisations. I have developed particular expertise in issues of migration and migrant integration, participation, inclusion and housing of migrants and other vulnerable groups, civil society and citizen participation, urban development and adaptation to climate change, but also on issues of multilevel governance and social innovation.  I am available for national and international research projects and interim functions as researcher and research manager.

Available for new assignments

profile_positions.description:
Het Onderzoekerscollectief is het samenwerkingsverband van zelfstandige onderzoekers in het sociaal domein. 

• Samen met onze opdrachtgevers zetten we ons in voor een samenleving waarin iedereen mee kan doen.
• Met ons onderzoek leveren wij de kennis om het beleid en de praktijken in het sociaal domein te verbeteren.

Ons onderzoek geeft nieuwe inzichten, afgewogen adviezen, meer draagvlak en/of werkbare oplossingen. Afhankelijk van de vorm en inhoud die we samen met onze opdrachtgever bepalen.

Als zelfstandig onderzoekers zijn we betrokken, nieuwsgierig, flexibel en efficiënt.
profile_positions.title: Lid

profile_positions.description: I have conducted research and consultancy work for public sector organisations, knowledge institutes and NGOs on labour market participation of migrant youth and older migrants, migrant youth in vocational education, emigration of Turkish migrants, etc. I have contributed to EUKN (European Urban Knowledge Network) research management and research reports on urban challenges commissioned by various EU Presidencies (Cyprus, Ireland, Lithuania, Greece, Latvia, Luxembourg and the Netherlands) and European expert meetings and conferences,  on various issues, including the inclusion of refugees, intra-EU migration, prevention of radicalisation and polarisation, urban poverty, the civic economy, urban development, and the circular city. Currently I am also teaching research skills at the HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (SJD).

profile_positions.description: Responsible for development and implementation of an evaluation study on the Green Sticht casus, as one of the Utrecht case studies of the European InnoSI project (Innovative Social Investment: Strengthening communities in Europe http://innosi.eu), Horizon 2020. Conducting and analysing interviews and focus groups, collecting and analysing documents in support of the reconstruction of the theory of change and the assessment of the needs and evaluation of the process and impact of the Green Sticht initiative. The Green Sticht initiative aims at reintegrating homeless people and supporting other socially vulnerable people by providing temporary housing for homeless, mixed housing for social vulnerable and self-reliant citizens, a living and working community and employment opportunities for people far away from the labour market.
